definition: male/Baron, lowest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/CL:個|个[ge4]

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: Frank was very kind, manly, open-hearted .
sentences.chinese: 弗兰克体贴，坦率，有男子气。

sentences.english: She likes you. Maybe she just wants you to be a man and do something.
sentences.chinese: 她喜欢你，也许她希望你拿出男子气，采取行动。

sentences.english: I want to fill my arms with your manly body.
sentences.chinese: 我很想把你男子气的身体拥在我的怀里。

sentences.english: They are unremittingly masculine, in the shallowest sense of the word.
sentences.chinese: 从最浅显的意义上说，他们非常男子气。

sentences.english: No doubt there will be more macho photo-opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 毫无疑问还会有普金充满男子气的照片出现。
和你的男子气挥手告别。

sentences.english: Macho heroes in films are bad role models for children.
sentences.chinese: 电影中那些大男子气的英雄是不宜孩子们模仿的。

sentences.english: Too macho or scared to see a doctor?
sentences.chinese: 太男子气或害怕去看医生？

definition: the impact of a piece of writing on the reader/gentle/refined
